name: Onyx Sleet TTPs
description: TTPs identified in Onyx Sleet's campaigns

techniques.comment: This technique is used by Onyx Sleet in campaigns. They routinely develop new variants of these RATs to add new functionality and implement new ways of evading detection.
Onyx Sleet has historically leveraged spear-phishing as a means of compromising target environments.
In recent campaigns, Onyx Sleet has mostly exploited N-day vulnerabilities, leveraging publicly available and custom exploits to gain initial access.
The actor creates an extensive set of custom tools and malware in order to enable effective infiltration, persistence and evasion in target networks.
The threat actor manipulates access tokens to make itself appear as a legitimate user, thereby bypassing authentication mechanisms and evading detection.
Onyx Sleet often uses leased virtual private servers (VPS) and compromised cloud infrastructure for command-and-control (C2).
Onyx Sleet heavily uses custom encryption and obfuscation algorithms to avoid detection.

Onyx Sleet has been observed to use several off-the-shelf tools, like Sliver, remote monitoring and management (RMM) tools SOCKS proxy tools, Ngrok, and masscan to navigate and exfiltrate data from the compromised networks.
Onyx Sleet has shown the capability of exploiting publicly disclosed (N-day) vulnerabilities to gain access to target environments.
In past campaigns, Onxy Sleet was involved in the exfiltration of sensitive data from targeted organizations.
Onyx Sleet has used custom malware families like Dtrack, Dora RAT, SmallTiger, and many more in their operations.
